intro: Seemannia cuneata, commonly known as the narrowleaf seemannia, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in grassland and rocky habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Seemannia cuneata is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
